poem:
Title: Stroke By Stroke, Frame by Frame

In blackened strokes a new identity,
Unfurls, tales of ebony on canvas.
The hourglass, never pausing, always pressing,
As we catch reflections in the paint.
Under Blake's stern gaze, in galleries echoing,
Romantics whisper from the walls.
Every dust stroke on David, a testament
To an ever-echoing dialogue of art.
Time insists - Now, now, always now!
